results.title: Passage west. Program 2: The Awakening
results.creator_credit: Philip Donnellan, Bill Brind, British Broadcasting Corporation and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Program 2 looks at the fortunes and misfortunes of British immigrants to Prince Edward Island, through a re-enactment of their history, letters, diaries, and interviews with their children and grandchildren.

results.title: Devdas
results.creator_credit: Bimal Roy and Bimal Roy Productions
results.brief_description: The setting is pre-independence Bengal - Devdas and Paro are childhood neighbours who grow up together sharing an innocent and joyful friendship, despite their different social status. Whilst still a young man and quite a prankster, Devdas is sent to Calcutta to study and in order to help him mature. He returns home years later a handsome man and Paro has blossomed into a true beauty. Disregarding their mutual love for one another, Devdas’ parents oppose the match, due to Paro’s lowly status, and her parents arrange for her to marry another. Paro is willing to risk all, including her reputation for their love but Devdas, weak and unable to defy his family, cannot, and is driven to despair and alcoholism. Directed by Bimil Roy, this film is lyrical and understated in its evocation of the lovers’ sorrow. Features numerous songs with original music composed by Sachin Dev Burman and lyrics by Sahir Ludhianvi and incandescent black and white cinematography. Starring: Dilip Kumar, Vijantimala and Suchitra Sen. From the novel by Sarat Chandra Chatterjee.

results.title: Development without tears?
results.creator_credit: Tina Viljoen, Barrie Howells and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: One-third of the world’s people live in the rural areas of the Middle East, Asia and Africa. Although industrial development programs have vastly improved life in the cities, Third World countries are now faced with the need to revitalize their rural societies. The question is how to accomplish that. Each of these nations now realizes it must find its own answers.

results.title: Mummy, daddy Lenin and Mao
results.creator_credit: Dick Foster, Eurfron Gwynne Jones and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Parents and Children”.
One of a series of films contrasting child care in China, Israel, Russia and Sweden with Britain. Urie Bronfenbrenner considers the changes that are taking place in the traditional roles of men and women both in the family and in the world at large.

results.title: Goals for the future
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Parents and Children”.
One of a series of films contrasting child care in China, Israel, Russia and Sweden with Britain. Considers such topics as family breakdown, violence and vandalism, and alienation in youth.

results.title: Passage Out of Paradise
results.brief_description: A thousand miles in an open outrigger canoe, voyaging through some of the most beautiful islands and most treacherous waters on earth! This is the challenge accepted by nine crews from all over the world who gather in Bali to sail through the Indonesian archipelago, across the Timor Sea to Darwin. For crews of young men and women from Australia, U.K., Holland, Germany, France, Japan, U.S.A., New Zealand and Indonesia, it was an adventure that they will never forget.

results.title: Part time parent, full time job
results.creator_credit: Dick Foster, Eurfron Gwynne Jones and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Parents and Children”.
Society expects parents to be both workers and up-bringers. Two societies have made conscious attempts to resolve the conflict between the world of work and the family - Sweden and the Israeli Kibbutz.

results.title: Passage
results.creator_credit: Normand Gregoire, Rene Jodoin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film shows the capacity of the camera to suspend or speed up the viewer’s perception of motion. It is a film without words or people, where the screen is alive with light, movement and sound. Fleeting impressions are greatly accelerated as from the windows of a speeding train. The sun rockets through a vortex of clouds, light flickers — all to the shythm of chattering wheels.
